title: PHPrtrim()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPrtrim()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Remove characters from the right side of a string: "; echo rtrim($str,"World!"); ?> Definition and Usage The rtrim() function removes whitespace or other predefined characters from the right side of a string. Related functions: ltrim() - Removes whitespace or other predefined characters from the left side of a string trim() - Removes whitespace or other predefined characters from both sides of a string Syntax rtrim( string,charlist ) Parameter Values Parameter Description string Required. Specifies the string to check charlist Optional. Specifies which characters to remove from the string. If omitted, all of the following characters are removed: "\0" - NULL "\t" - tab "\n" - new line "\x0B" - vertical tab "\r" - carriage return " " - ordinary white space Technical Details Return Value: Returns the modified string PHP Version: 4+ Changelog: The charlist parameter was added in PHP 4.1 More Examples Example Remove whitespaces from the right side of a string: "; echo "With rtrim: " . rtrim($str); ?> The HTML output of the code above will be (View Source): Without rtrim: Hello World!    
With rtrim: Hello World! The browser output of the code above will be: Without rtrim: Hello World! With rtrim: Hello World! Example Remove newlines (\n) from the right side of a string: "; echo "With rtrim: " . rtrim($str); ?> The HTML output of the code above will be (View Source): Without rtrim: Hello World!
With rtrim: Hello World! The browser output of the code above will be: Without rtrim: Hello World! With rtrim: Hello World! ★ +1

quiz.question: What is all of the following characters?
options:
removed:
"\0" - NULL
"\t" - tab
"\n" - new line
"\x0B" - vertical tab
"\r" - carriage return
" " - ordinary white space
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns the modified string
PHP Version:
4+
Changelog:
The
charlist
parameter was added in PHP 4
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of all of the following characters is 'removed:
"\0" - NULL
"\t" - tab
"\n" - new line
"\x0B" - vertical tab
"\r" - carriage return
" " - ordinary white space
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns the modified string
PHP Version:
4+
Changelog:
The
charlist
parameter was added in PHP 4'.

summary: This tutorial covers PHPrtrim()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPrtrim()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPrtrim()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
